questions.question_text:
You have a Microsoft 365 E5 subscription that has Microsoft Defender for Office 365 enabled.
You need to review the zero-hour auto purge (ZAP) configuration for the subscription.
Which two threat policies should you review? Each correct answer presents part of the solution.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BF
Thank you JimboJones99 for providing that link. With the link I found the following statements that confirm the ExamTopics provided answers:
1) "ZAP for malware is enabled by default in anti-malware policies." https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-365/security/office-365-security/zero-hour-auto-purge?view=o365-worldwide#zero-hour-auto-purge-zap-for-malware
2) "By default, ZAP for phishing is enabled in anti-spam policies[...]" https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-365/security/office-365-security/zero-hour-auto-purge?view=o365-worldwide#zero-hour-auto-purge-zap-for-phishing

for me B,E and F are protect under ZAP, but under thread Policies i see only B Anti-Malware and E Antiphising not F Anti spam

https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-365/security/office-365-security/zero-hour-auto-purge?view=o365-worldwide

Selected Answer: BF
Check the video
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-365/security/office-365-security/zero-hour-auto-purge?view=o365-worldwide
Valid on Exam 9/21/2022
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-365/security/office-365-security/zero-hour-auto-purge?view=o365-worldwide
BF. Answer is correct
Not sure about this one..

Selected Answer: B
According to this 'if you edit a sensitivity label, the version of the label that was applied to the document remains in effect' So the answer is Absolutely B, as the question does not mention the user reapplying the label.
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-365/compliance/sensitivity-labels?view=o365-worldwide

comments.content: the count start again in january 4 when user 2 modify the document. january 24 is the option

discussion.content:
On January 3, User1 creates a Microsoft Word document named Doc1 and applies Label1 to the document.... 3+28 = 31.

Label can't be applied if document not even created

“ Editing or deleting a sensitivity label:

If you delete a sensitivity label from the admin portal, the label is not automatically removed from content, and any protection settings continue to be enforced on content that had that label applied.
If you edit a sensitivity label, the version of the label that was applied to content is what's enforced on that content.”

The correct answer is B

Selected Answer: D
3+21+7 = 31

Selected Answer: D
“Assign permissions now” 
So on 2nd the permissions get applied and expires on 23rd (after 2+21) and then it is modified to 28 days so expires after 30th i.e, 31st. (2+28).

It is either B or D
Label applied on Jan 3.
Content expiry period (after 21 days) -> Initial setting
Then it was increased it to (28 days)
So either 3 + 21 = 24 or 3 + 28 = 31
Both are possible and I could not find any information which one is correct ..

Selected Answer: D
if my math is correct:3+21+7 = 31

comments.content: I think it's rather 28 + 3 (the day the doc was edited) =31

3rd it's the day of creation and label application
but the math is correct, imo

discussion.content: I will go for C: January 25

questions.question_text:
You have a Microsoft 365 E5 subscription that contains two users named User1 and User2.
On January 1, you create the sensitivity label shown in the following table.
//IMG//

On January 2, you publish Label1 to User1.
On January 3, User1 creates a Microsoft Word document named Doc1 and applies Label1 to the document.
On January 4, User2 edits Doc1.
On January 15, you increase the content expiry period for Label1 to 28 days.
When will access to Doc1 expire for User2?

discussion.content:
Answer is YNN indeed.
Want to point out to people here that the user name is admin1, but Microsoft is not stating the user has any compliance admin roles or so, so read the question very carefully all the time :-)

The answer should be Y, N, N as per record management documentation.
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-365/compliance/records-management?view=o365-worldwide

This question is not elaborated, because it says Mark item as record" whether record is locked or unlocked, based on that answer will differ, if consider that record is locked then Ans is Y,N,N
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-365/compliance/records-management?view=o365-worldwide#compare-restrictions-for-what-actions-are-allowed-or-blocked

Answers are correct to me: N, Y, N
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-365/compliance/declare-records?view=o365-worldwide
User1 can rename File1. NO
We have "Mark Item as a record" – this means:
Users won’t be able to edit or delete items, and only Admins will be able to change or remove labels
Admin1 can modify the content of File1. YES
Users can remove retention1 from File1. NO

comments.content: Sorry, I got it incorrectly. It should be Y, N, N

questions.question_text:
HOTSPOT -
You have a Microsoft 365 E5 subscription that contains two users named Admin1 and User1, a Microsoft SharePoint Online site named Site1, and a retention label named Retention1.
The role assignments for Site1 are shown in the following table.
//IMG//

Site1 includes a file named File1.
Rentention1 has the following settings:
* Retain items for a specific period: Retention period: 7 years
* During the retention period: Mark items as a record
* At the end of the retention period: Delete items automatically
Rentention1 is published to Site1.
User1 applies Retention1 to File1.
For each of the following statements, select Yes if the statement is true. Otherwise, select No.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.
Hot Area:
//IMG//

HOTSPOT
-

You have a Microsoft 365 E5 subscription that contains two users named User1 and User2.

You add the users to the roles and the role group as shown in the following table.

//IMG//


From the Microsoft Purview compliance portal, you perform an audit log search for the Added member to Role activity.

Which role assignments will be returned for each user? To answer, select the appropriate options in the answer area.

NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

//IMG//

discussion.content: I don't understand, there is no Cloud Discovery Global Administrator role.

YES - NO - YES
I believe answer is correct; keyword is the direction - it is inbound only. User 2 inbound mail will not be viewed due to the exclusion but if user 2 sends it to someone not excluded then it will be available for review.

comments.content: It is inbound rule, not from but to - User1, user1 is included, so YNY.

discussion.content: User 2 excluded - YNN
